programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether common human rituals may have been inspired by contact with aliens.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick needs to find spare parts for an alarm clock that gives the sleeper electric shocks, and also tries to turn a petrol pump into a sports locker.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is challenged to convert a 1960s Volkswagen Beetle into a child's bed.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick tries to restore a 1920s Haunted House car with the help of Ted and new painter Niko. The vehicle was damaged during Hurricane Sandy.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick tries to turn a mini-version of a 1962 Corvette into a powerful convertible, before restoring a 1950s coin-operated children's ride.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz explore a warehouse belonging to country musician Mickey Gilley, and find a sign used in the movie Urban Cowboy.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The future of Browning, Smith and Hewitt's careers is uncertain as they face their company bosses.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Tempers at S&S Aqua Logging flare, while Rygaard and Conner Aviation welcome some fresh faces and hope the new staff will fare better than their previous recruits.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale gets to work on a beaten-up 1940s boxing bell, before a client brings in a vintage slot machine to be converted into a beer dispenser.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick transforms a child's bicycle from the 1970s, and the owner offers to perform stunts on it for the team in return for a discount.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Investigating a theory that there was more than the previously alleged single UFO crash site in Roswell, New Mexico.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The sighting of a large boomerang-shaped object in Arizona after people witnessed a string of fiery globes on the same night in 1997.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at how the lives of FedEx flight 705's crew were placed in jeopardy when they came under attack from a hijacker above Memphis.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Examining how Chicago's skyscrapers would fare if a tornado such as the one that tore across the city in 1967 were to strike today.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank spend a large sum of money on cars, bikes and vintage advertising material in Michigan, but it remains to be seen if they can make a profit on their purchases.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The duo find a valuable collection of vintage toys in Iowa, while Mike is inspired to take a gamble on an unusual item.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les's relationship deteriorates further as a string of problems in the warehouse threatens to bleed the business dry.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les discovers Seth's master plan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman catches her boyfriend trying to sell her ring, and Les gets his hands on some valuable rock memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les is tempted to break one of the shop's most important rules when a fast-talking client catches him off-guard.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley discovers a potential robber hiding in the fridge, but Les ignores her cries to increase security - which is a decision he may regret come nightfall.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finds himself unable to stop spending, and is under pressure to make sales before being branded a hoarder.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave threatens to dampen high spirits at an early morning auction, and Mary struggles to stop the other buyers from getting her down.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers have big dreams of making it in Hollywood. Despite his hatred of Tinseltown, Dave takes a major gamble on an unusual locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to a first-class auction in Arcadia, but when bids quickly start reaching into the thousands, Mary is left struggling to keep up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go back to Montebello, where some of their biggest finds and greatest dramas have occurred.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hope for hidden treasures at auctions in Moreno Valley, as Dave attempts to make his mark on new territory, while Mary tries out a risky new idea.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The teams make a long trip to auctions in Palm Desert, and Mary plays a risky game when she bids way beyond her budget.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi hope for more good luck as the buyers return to San Diego, while Ivy comes across a cross-dressing locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary learns a harsh lesson about Dave at auctions in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, while Rene puts a secret strategy to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Locker
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at auctions in Lancaster, where Mary chooses a surprising ally. Meanwhile, Jarrod and Brandi turn up the pressure.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan's American Hustle
programme.desc: In their final stop on their hustling tour of America, Ronnie and Matt Smith hit San Francisco for what they hope will be one last score.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: A shocking new discovery at Smith's Cove suggests that the origin of the Oak Island mystery may date much earlier, and be more profound, than the treasure hunters suspected.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy goes hunting for a cannibal gator that has been ruining his season, while Glenn Guist does battle with 'the leaning house of Louisiana'.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Eustace battles a beast to bring home a bonus payday. In pursuit of a lion, Jake's team is left hanging on a cliff's edge.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe, Romesh Ranganathan and Ed Gamble join regulars Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines in July 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian, writer and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with stand-up Ross Noble and journalist Mona Chalabi joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: It Was an Accident and I Was Hospitalised
programme.desc: The presenter addresses so-called guilty pleasures and how some fans of things can take all of the fun out of liking something.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Comedy, starring Lee Mack.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Toby organises a sponsored parachute jump to raise money for a children's ward in his hospital, so Lee, Lucy, Anna and the grandparents all agree to take part to support him. But once airborne, will everyone pluck up the courage to jump? Return of the comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The tensions of sharing a weekend cottage with friends are much in evidence as Lee and Lucy spend three nights in the New Forest with Toby and Anna. The beautiful countryside is forgotten as they squabble over who has the better bedroom, where they should go on their day trips, who should do the cooking and who should stay behind on the last day to tidy up the cottage. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith engages in a high-speed pursuit after spotting a car being driven with a flat tyre. Even after the tyre disintegrates at 90mph, the driver still refuses to stop.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take a continental trip in their favourite supercars - the Ford GT, Ferrari F430 and Pagani Zonda. There is a culture clash when the Austin Healey Sprite and Peugeot 306 go head to head, and the Focus ST is put through its paces on the track. Then-transport minister Stephen Ladyman drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.sub-title: Messenger Statue, Steam Fair, Lego Dinosaurs
programme.desc: The team at King's Haulage deal with the UK's largest bronze sculpture when it berths at Plymouth Docks, while the race is on to deliver a herd of Lego dinosaurs to Marwell Zoo.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: The journey of a $55million batch of cancer pharmaceuticals from Northern Ireland to Heathrow, for a flight to the US. A wildlife officer attempts to scare birds away from a runway.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of police officers through body-worn cameras.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A group of angry locals trap an innocent man in a telephone box and accuse him of being a paedophile, and a woman claims her boyfriend is trying to kill her.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: A Second World War anti-aircraft gun must be deconstructed on the island of Hoy, and a new concept in floating homes is sent hundreds of miles to York.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Featuring all the thrills and spills from the 2013 Red Bull Soapbox Race in London, as the crews unleash their four-wheeled, motorless creations on a challenging downhill course littered with obstacles.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and comedians Rhod Gilbert, Rufus Hound and Miranda Hart are the guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by TV presenter Patrick Kielty, actor Bernard Cribbins, Dragons' Den judge Deborah Meaden and comedian Mark Watson on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall visits Fort Worth, Texas, where he takes on a monster pancake challenge, a painful rodeo test, and local delicacy calves' testes in the world's largest Honky Tonk venue.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie hits San Antonio to sample the finest Tex-Mex food and a gigantic chicken fried steak - with no chicken. He also tests whether he has the moves for TV show Ninja Warrior.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Dan and Anna are behind a driver refusing to stop after they spot him smashing into a parked car. When the driver brakes, the pair swiftly realise that the car is about to ram them.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Victoria Coren Mitchell, Sue Perkins and the Rev Richard Coles join regular panellist Alan Davies on the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of knights and knaves, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian, writer and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with stand-up Ross Noble and journalist Mona Chalabi joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O'Briain, Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Milton Jones and Ed Gamble to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines, through stand-up spots and improvised games. First aired in September 2015.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: This week Greg Davies and assistant Alex Horne engage in some role-play to assess the success of a throwing task, and Noel Fielding has a sliding session.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Arthur Smith, Doon Mackichan, Andy Hamilton and Alan Davies answer host Stephen Fry's questions on crime, cuisine and the contents of the Queen's handbag, with points awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The stories behind the most important trains in history and their impact on the world, beginning with a look at the first locomotives during the Industrial Revolution.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: A Very British Murder with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian tells the story of one of the first high-profile killers - Dr Crippen, who was hanged in 1910 for poisoning and dismembering his wife - before turning her attention to the interwar period, when detective fiction reached the peak of its popularity at the hands of authors Agatha Christie and Dorothy L Sayers. After undergoing the elaborate initiation ceremony of the Detection Club, which was set up by a group of British writers in 1930, Lucy considers how Alfred Hitchcock's films and Graham Greene's books eclipsed the traditional murder-mystery story in the depiction of homicide.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates a horrifying discovery made in a Brighton left luggage office in 1934 - which was soon followed by a similar suspicious incident in London.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day examines the 1949 murder of wealthy widow Olive Durand, and the gruesome confession made by the man who was brought in for questioning.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates the murder of two teenagers in 1953, their bodies discovered the day before and a few days after the Queen's coronation.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates a horrifying discovery made in a Brighton left luggage office in 1934 - which was soon followed by a similar suspicious incident in London.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day examines the 1949 murder of wealthy widow Olive Durand, and the gruesome confession made by the man who was brought in for questioning.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates the murder of two teenagers in 1953, their bodies discovered the day before and a few days after the Queen's coronation.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Michelle enlists Rene to set up a mobile radio station to broadcast propaganda, the parts of which will be dropped by plane. Unfortunately, they fall down one of the chateau's chimneys. Second World War comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Resistance leader Michelle blackmails Von Strohm and Gruber for 10 million francs, after revealing she has a photograph of the pair holding the Fallen Madonna, while Herr Flick gives Helga a truth drug to discover the location of the painting.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: It's Rene's birthday and surprises include a car from Edith, a wink from Hitler and a bomb from the Resistance. The celebration concludes with a bang.

programme.title: Queen Elizabeth's Secret Agents
programme.desc: The docudrama focuses on the machinations of ambitious aristocrat the Earl of Essex as he tries to take over Robert Cecil's spy network in an attempt to gain control over the ageing Elizabeth I and hold the power to choose the next king of England.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Tara's party antics get her in trouble and send Hugh spiralling on his birthday. Meryl investigates Whyhope's subsidence reports.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Elizabeth decides to organise a formal party to demonstrate how out of her depth Sarah is. Meanwhile, Carolyn is shocked by Jack's revelation when she challenges him to confront his intimacy issues, and Regina returns home from Europe with news about Sarah. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah is closer to George than ever after her triumph at the Swansons' party. However, their happiness is short-lived when they are faced with Regina's bombshell, which sends shockwaves through Inverness. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Play to the Whistle
programme.desc: Host Holly Willoughby keeps captains Frank Lampard and Bradley Walsh in check, with guests including GB hockey Olympic gold medallist Sam Quek, sports presenter Jake Humphrey and comedian Rob Beckett. Also providing the laughs are comedians Romesh Ranganathan and Seann Walsh.

programme.title: Animal Mums
programme.desc: Nature documentary revealing how animals cope with the demands of raising their offspring. The first episode follows newborn lambs and foals as their mothers help them to learn to walk, a gorilla in a safari park going through a difficult birth and a white rhino mutilated by hunters that gives birth to a calf, but will have a hard time protecting it. Plus, a look at how highland cows and pigs nurse their young - and a seal that is not able to. Featuring Adam Henson, narrated by Hugh Bonneville.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton visits Germany, where he discovers a nuclear core from a secret Nazi weapon-testing factory.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.desc: A participant in the exorcism that inspired the movie The Exorcist reveals his experience. Plus, the baffling case of 100 dead elk.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini visits McPherson College looking for three apprentices to join his team. The students assemble a Model T and the winners are announced.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini travels to Ohio to buy a Pierce Arrow, but is forced to pull out of the purchase when the owner backtracks on his decision to sell.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Tragic Tsunami, Plummeting Plane, Canadian Catastrophe
programme.desc: Footage of near disasters, featuring a train hauling toxic materials crashing into a trapped truck and a plane suffering engine failure while in flight.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Flash flooding causes havoc in a Spanish village, a liquid petroleum store in Brazil puts a residential area in danger, and a double motorbike crash is caught on camera.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a dragboat racer ejecting while travelling at 165mph, a 100-ton train crashing into a bus, and a skydiver cartwheeling out of control. Ron Pitts presents a documentary series investigating the natural disasters and accidents that have caused excessive damage, from tornados to plane crashes.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith and Jimmy de Ville head to Korea to find out how it made world-beating cars in just a few years. Jimmy revisits the original Bentley Blower and Jason Plato hits the track in an Alpine A110

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics repair and revamp a 1964 Oldsmobile Dynamic 88 as it's full-time father owner, David Currier, is struggling to devote enough time to maintain it.

programme.title: James May: The Reassembler
programme.desc: The presenter continues in his quest to put history back together again one piece at a time by tackling a 1957 Bakelite dial telephone, a challenge involving 211 pieces.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including stained glass and a Victorian hay rack that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Huddersfield Town v Leeds United and Queens Park Rangers v Preston North End.

programme.desc: Treasure hunter Drew Pritchard counts down some of his most memorable buys, from the incredibly rare and valuable to the exquisite and the quirky.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard turns his attention to 'surprise buys' as he counts down through some of his most memorable purchases.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill Carlton and his team give a purple '55 Chevy truck a modern update, with a modified hood and scoop, a handmade interior and new wood bed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to double his money by working with expert mechanic Edd China to turn an Austin-Healey Frogeye Sprite into a quality classic car. Once completed, the duo test-drive it around the Brooklands Motor Museum in Surrey, prior to selling it on at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer wants a high-performance car with a historic badge, but it proves difficult to find a Saab 9-3 Turbo at a good price for mechanic Edd China to refurbish.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including stained glass and a Victorian hay rack that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Swimming with Monsters with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist tries to swim with Africa's most dangerous animal, the hippopotamus, in an attempt to study its secret underwater behaviour.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: Follows the interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain who are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: Follows the interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain who are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith and Jimmy de Ville head to Korea to find out how it made world-beating cars in just a few years. Jimmy revisits the original Bentley Blower and Jason Plato hits the track in an Alpine A110

programme.title: Taken at Birth
programme.desc: Jane and Lisa meet the first Hicks baby, Stephen Dilbeck. Plus, Chris and Hicks' granddaughter Sallie open a vault in search of birth records that may be inside.

programme.title: Taken at Birth
programme.desc: After 70 years of searching, Stephen receives some shocking news regarding his birth family. Chris and Sallie are close to getting important information.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old student Katie Poirier, who vanished while working the graveyard shift at a petrol station. CCTV footage revealed an answer - but left a community in fear.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The 1992 deaths of Tommy Griffin and his sister Connie Griffin Branham, both killed by shotgun wounds to the head. Gary Wayne Sutton and James Henderson - associates of Tommy Griffin - were convicted of the murders. Connie was killed a few days after her sibling while enquiring his whereabouts.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: An investigation into a US bank robbery in 1997, during which two armed men opened fire on staff and police officers at close range.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A race against time sees an AHS team battling to save a kitten trapped in a maze of underground pipes. Plus, a dog with a fatal injury is the centre of a shocking case.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa is tasked with saving a five-year-old's paralysed dachshund, while Dr Chris is presented with a list by another little girl.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress from her hometown that proves hard to obtain, while another customer takes a liking to a satin dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Monisha has come to Kleinfeld's looking for a dress for her three wedding ceremonies, while Mary has a budget of $30,000 to buy two gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: After spending her youth in outfits covered in bling, Emily wants to wear a traditional gown on her big day. Fashionista Diana is looking for a strapless gown, but her mother has other ideas. At her fitting, Jackie is still looking for her mother's approval.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An angry and injured python puts Tim's team to the test in the reptile house and Chris faces his worst nightmare - a big crocodile that needs urgent treatment.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A lamb falls victim to a vicious dog attack, and Chris is determined to save the animal's life. Tim finds the world's deadliest spider in his friend's house.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing in at almost 700lbs, 50-year-old Pauline has an addiction to food that is slowly killing her and destroying her son's life as her carer. Can she get back on track?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Melissa deals with an unplanned pregnancy, and Ashley seeks new inspiration when her weight loss grinds to a halt.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A woman tries to lose enough weight to qualify for skin removal surgery, while a patient at a Beverly Hills clinic finds her treatment tougher than expected.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson Galaxy turns his attention to a domestic cat that attacks everyone else in the house, and an adopted stray that is struggling to shed its aggressive side.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Katie's body confidence is at rock bottom after her bikini shoot in Ibiza, so she heads to Turkey to go under the knife. And, a trip to the House of Commons ends in drama.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Back from her plastic surgery, Katie makes a public appearance - this time Harvey is the focus. With Kris, they take three of the kids on holiday to Majorca.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: As Katie recovers from surgery, her house is next in line for a makeover. And, her fertility consultation puts her relationship with Kris to the test..

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Katie prepares to relaunch her pop career, though with her suspicious of Kris's loyalty and facing prosecution over a row with Kieran's new girlfriend, things spiral out of control.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the life of the model, businesswoman and celebrity, offering an access-all-areas pass into her life with family and friends, at work and at play.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa performs with her old folk group while helping with a fundraiser for a friend. She also reconnects a friend with his mother.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa surprises a firefighter with a reading, but he fears his son will not make contact. The medium and Larry get competitive when they attend a sushi-making class.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert helps out with a health check for the zoo's unusual-looking alligator snapping turtles. Terri and Bindi welcome seven new lemurs from the US.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Lisa Joyner hopes that finding a man's biological mother will help him overcome his lifelong struggle with abandonment. Chris Jacobs is tasked with locating a woman's only child.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Andrew Cameron, James Cameron & Alexander Dewar: The Revenge Attack
programme.desc: In 2009, the sleepy Norfolk village of Fakenham was hit with the horrific and brutal murder of 45-year-old Steven Murphy. Andrew Cameron and his friend Alexander Dewar denied the act, but were convicted by a jury at Norwich Crown Court.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of the Genesee River serial killer, Arthur Hutchinson, reveal how his heinous crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of murderous intentions?.

programme.title: Taken at Birth
programme.desc: Jane and Lisa share news regarding the exhumation with a group of Hicks babies that have questioned whether he was in fact their biological father.
